What are some new features available in Verus Desktop, and how can these features be used to explore and develop on the Verus testnet?

Verus Desktop has introduced two new exciting features: a 3D cross-chain liquidity network visualizer and new PBaaS capabilities. 

**3D Cross-Chain Liquidity Network Visualizer:**
The 3D cross-chain liquidity network visualizer is a graphical user interface (GUI) that allows users to visualize the Verus testnet in a three-dimensional space. This visualizer displays all currency conversion and fractional network connections, both on-chain and cross-chain, in a 3D environment. Users can interact with the visualizer by moving around, zooming in and out, and exploring the network connections in 3D. This feature can be accessed by clicking on "Visualize Network" on the Metaverse tab of Verus Desktop.

**New PBaaS Capabilities:**
All PBaaS (Public Blockchain as a Service) capabilities, including those for application development, are now available on the Verus testnet. This means that developers can start building and testing their applications on the testnet, utilizing Verus's transformative technologies. The goal of interoperability on this new testnet is to enable seamless connections between different blockchain networks, starting with the Ethereum/Rinkeby bridge. With these new capabilities, developers can get a head start on using Verus's innovative technologies and explore the possibilities of building on the Verus testnet.

**Exploring and Developing on the Verus Testnet:**
The Verus testnet provides a sandbox environment for developers to experiment, build, and test their applications and ideas. With the new PBaaS capabilities and the 3D cross-chain liquidity network visualizer, developers can gain a deeper understanding of the Verus ecosystem and its potential for building innovative applications. By exploring and developing on the testnet, developers can get familiar with Verus's unique features and be prepared to deploy their projects on the mainnet when it becomes available.

## NEW 3D CROSS-CHAIN LIQUIDITY NETWORK VISUALIZER (GUI FOR TESTNET)
In v0.9.2 Verus Desktop, there is a new 3-dimensional cross-chain network visualizer, which shows all currency conversion and fractional network connections both on chain and cross-chain, with the ability to move around and zoom in and out in 3 dimensions. To access the visualizer, click on “Visualize Network” on the Metaverse tab of Verus Desktop. If you’re interested in seeing the visualizer now, here’s a link directly to the visualizer as part of a recent video members of the community helped make (https://youtu.be/CkgUVjx_g1M?t=43).## NEW PBAAS CAPABILITIES
All PBaaS capabilities, including for application development, are available now on the new Verus testnet. Our goal for interoperability on this new testnet is to launch the Ethereum/Rinkeby bridge in the next couple days. Now would be a good time for development capable projects hoping to get a head start on using Verus’s transformative technologies to do a deep dive on the Verus testnet.
